intro: Neoboivinella kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro boivinella, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in the cooler, moist climates of mountainous areas. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, stipulate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
